page.title: 05Education in The Shelsleys.A
page.content: There is no school or playgroup within the area under examination, all school children being bussed into nearby schools since the village school became too small to be economically viable. Of the 50 plus children of school age, the pupils of primary school age are collected by bus to{Great Witley Church of England {Primary School}, which is a well-established church school five miles distant, with 5 teachers and about 120 pupils under 11 in a country setting. The other primary option offered is at{Clifton Primary School}, but if this smaller school is chosen (60 pupils) the County does not provide free transport. About 15 local children attend{independent {schools}mainly in Worcester and Kidderminster, while 7 of this number board.
